item.title: Huawei Founder Waves Off Chip Curbs as Trade Talks Proceed
item.description: Huawei Technologies Co. founder Ren Zhengfei dismissed the impact of US export restrictions on China in a front-page People’s Daily article, wading into one of the key topics dogging Washington-Beijing trade negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Edwin Chan, Jessica Sui

media:content.media:description: Ren Zhengfei, founder and chief executive officer of Huawei Technologies Co., poses for a photograph following a Bloomberg Television interview at the company's headquarters in Shenzhen, China, on Friday, May 24, 2019. Ren, the billionaire founder of China's largest technology company, conceded that Trump administration export curbs will narrow a two-year lead Huawei had painstakingly built over rivals like Ericsson AB and Nokia Oyj. But the company will either ramp up its own chip supply or find alternatives to keep its edge in smartphones and 5G. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: US Deploys Marines to LA as Trump Tensions With Newsom Intensify
item.description: The Trump administration escalated its response to anti-deportation protests in Los Angeles with the mobilization of 700 Marines, deploying active-duty military on the ground and deepening tensions with California officials.
item.dc:creator: Alicia A. Caldwell, John Gittelsohn, Eliyahu Kamisher, Hadriana Lowenkron

media:content.media:description: A police officer in riot gear fires a nonlethal weapon toward protesters during a demonstration following federal immigration operations in Los Angeles on June 9, 2025. President Donald Trump's administration said on June 9 that it was sending 700 US Marines and thousands more National Guard troops to Los Angeles, sparking a furious response from California's governor over the "deranged" deployment. (Photo by RINGO CHIU / AFP) (Photo by RINGO CHIU/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Xi Urges South Korea’s Lee to Help Safeguard Free Trade in Call
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping held his first phone conversation with South Korea’s newly elected President Lee Jae-myung and called for cooperation to safeguard multilateralism and free trade.
item.dc:creator: Soo-Hyang Choi, Lin Chen

item.title: France’s Finance Minister Is the Calm Hand Macron Needs Now
item.description: Eric Lombard is deploying his deal making skills to avert political turmoil
item.dc:creator: William Horobin

media:content.media:description: Eric Lombard, France's finance minister, at the AI Action Summit in Paris, France, on Monday, Feb. 10, 2025. France is set to announce a total of €109 billion in investment in artificial intelligence projects in the country by companies, funds and other sources over the coming years, President Emmanuel Macron said on the eve of a two-day AI Action Summit.

item.title: White House Pitches Texas GOP on US House Redistricting Gambit
item.description: Members of Texas’ Republican congressional delegation met on Monday to discuss the prospect of redistricting to try and tilt the state further in the GOP’s favor before the 2026 midterm elections.
item.dc:creator: John Harney, Julie Fine

media:content.media:description: HOUSTON, TEXAS - NOVEMBER 02: Supporters listen from risers as Republican presidential candidate former U.S. President Donald Trump speaks during a campaign rally at the Trendsetter Engineering Inc. on November 02, 2023 in Houston, Texas. Former President Trump's visit to Houston marks his second stop in Texas since earlier this year. The visit comes as his sons Don Jr. and Eric testified at his civil fraud in New York trial today. Trump may be forced to sell off his properties after a judge ruled that he committed fraud for years while building his real estate empire. (Photo by Brandon Bell/Getty Images)

item.title: Israel Takes Greta Thunberg and Aid Boat Crew Into Custody, Group Says
item.description: All 12 people from an aid boat intercepted by Israel carrying Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg have arrived at port and are being transferred to the custody of Israeli authorities, the group involved said in a social media post.
item.dc:creator: Alisa Odenheimer, Jon Herskovitz

media:content.media:description: Greta Thunberg in a photo released by the Freedom Flotilla Coalition. Freedom Flotilla Coalition

item.title: Saudi Arabian Crown Prince MBS Gets G-7 Invitation From Canada
item.description: Canada has invited Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to attend the Group of Seven summit, according to a person familiar with the matter, in another sign of a new approach to foreign policy under Prime Minister Mark Carney.
item.dc:creator: Brian Platt

media:content.media:description: Mohammed bin Salman Photographer: Prakash Singh/Bloomberg

item.title: Japan’s Ishiba Pledges 50% Pay Rise by 2040 Ahead of Elections
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has set pay raises and a ¥1 quadrillion ($6.9 trillion) economy as the top campaign promises for this summer’s upper house election, as the date nears for voters to give their latest verdict on his administration.
item.dc:creator: Sakura Murakami

media:content.media:description: Shigeru Ishiba Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: Investors Bank on No-Frills Pakistan Budget to Keep Rally Alive
item.description: Investors in Pakistan are hoping Tuesday’s budget stays focused on slashing spending, boosting revenues, and reinforcing the government’s commitment to its International Monetary Fund loan program.
item.dc:creator: Malavika Kaur Makol, Kamran Haider

item.title: California Asks Court to Halt Trump Deploying Military in LA
item.description: California asked a federal court to halt the Trump administration’s “illegal” deployment of the state’s National Guard and the US Marines in Los Angeles to quell unrest over the president’s immigration raids.
item.dc:creator: Malathi Nayak, Bob Van Voris

media:content.media:description: LAPD officers and National Guard soldiers on patrol as demonstrators protest outside a downtown jail in Los Angeles, on June 8.

item.title: Ireland Needs Fiscal Rule as Economic Risk Grows, Watchdog Warns
item.description: The Irish government should commit to a domestic fiscal rule so it can better plan spending as the economy enters uncertain territory, the state’s fiscal watchdog warned.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Fletcher

media:content.media:description: Sunrise over the River Liffey in Dublin, Ireland, on Friday, Nov. 22, 2024. Ireland's election will be a big test of how the country handles its cash surplus. Photographer: Paulo Nunes dos Santos/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Says China ‘Not Easy’ as Trade Talks to Resume Tuesday
item.description: Trade talks between the US and China will continue into a second day, according to a US official, as the two sides look to ease tensions over shipments of technology and rare earth elements.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Flatley, Tyler Kendall

item.title: Pentagon Sends 700 Marines to Los Angeles, Escalating Response to Protests
item.description: The Trump administration is sending about 700 active duty Marines to reinforce the National Guard in response to protests in Los Angeles, the US Northern Command said Monday of a move continuing an escalation that California officials have called unwarranted.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Capaccio

media:content.media:description: Protesters stand on a vandalized vehicle during a demonstration in Los Angeles, on June 8.

item.title: California Sues Trump to Protect Its Transgender Athletes Policy
item.description: California sued to protect itself from the Trump administration’s threats to pull federal funding over a state law that allows transgender high school athletes to compete in female sports, the latest showdown between President Donald Trump and the most populous state.
item.dc:creator: Malathi Nayak

media:content.media:description: A demonstrator holds a transgender pride flag during a President’s Day protest near the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, Feb. 17, 2025. Thousands of probationary employees in multiple government agencies are facing dismissal as the Trump administration continued its effort to rapidly thin the ranks of federal workers. Photographer: Stefani Reynolds/Bloomberg

item.title: US Asks Appeals Court to Let Trump Tariffs Remain for Longer
item.description: A federal appeals court is closer to ruling on whether to keep most of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs in place longer while the legal battle over them continues.
item.dc:creator: Zoe Tillman

media:content.media:description: A container ship at the Port of Los Angeles in Los Angeles, California, US, on Friday, April 4, 2025. President Donald Trump blasted China for retaliating against his sweeping tariff plan and vowed his economic policies will never change, as the prospect of a trade war wreaked more havoc on the global economy.

item.title: France’s Macron Doesn’t Rule Out Calling Snap Elections Again
item.description: French president Emmanuel Macron said he doesn’t rule out the possibility of again dissolving the National Assembly and calling snap elections.
item.dc:creator: Samy Adghirni, Ania Nussbaum

media:content.media:description: France’s President Emmanuel Macron speaks during the United Nations Ocean Conference in Nice, France, on June 9.

item.title: Crucial Stablecoin Bill Vote Teed Up in the Senate for This Week
item.description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune has teed up a critical procedural vote Wednesday on stablecoin legislation supported by the crypto industry and President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Steven T. Dennis

media:content.media:description: The Rotunda of the US Capitol in Washington. Photographer: Al Drago/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Touts CEO Pledges on Tax Bill’s Child Savings Accounts
item.description: President Donald Trump touted a provision in his tax bill that would deposit $1,000 into an investment account for babies born in the next few years alongside corporate leaders who said they would aid the effort.
item.dc:creator: Josh Wingrove, Kate Sullivan

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump, center, during an Invest America roundtable in the State Dining Room of the White House in Washington, DC, on June 9.

item.title: California Labor Leader Charged With Felony After ICE Protest
item.description: California labor leader David Huerta has been charged with a federal felony, accused of interfering with law enforcement after joining a protest against immigration arrest operations in Los Angeles that set off days of unrest.
item.dc:creator: Alicia A. Caldwell, Laura Curtis

media:content.media:description: Demonstrators rally against US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and call for the release of union leader David Huerta, President of SEIU California and SEIU-USWW, who was arrested on June 6 during federal immigration operations, at Gloria Molina Grand Park in Los Angeles, on June 9, 2025.

item.title: Lula pasa de ser el “líder más popular del mundo”, a perder apoyo en Brasil
item.description: La elevada inflación y el descontento económico impactan la popularidad de Lula. Sus aliados afirman que el verdadero problema es que el presidente de 79 años sigue anclado en el pasado.
item.dc:creator: Simone Iglesias, Martha Viotti Beck

media:content.media:description: Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, Brazils president, center, at Planalto Palace after being sworn-in during an inauguration ceremony with his wife Rosangela da Silva, right, Geraldo Alckmin, Brazil's vice president, center left, and his wife Lu Alckmin, left, in Brasilia, Brazil, on Sunday, Jan. 1, 2023. Lula retakes the helm of Latin America's largest democracy promising to bring back the economic inclusion and prosperity that marked his first two terms in Brazil's highest office between 2003 and 2011.

item.title: Once the World’s ‘Most Popular Politician,’ Lula Is Losing His Way in Brazil
item.description: High inflation and economic discontent are hammering Lula’s approval. Allies say the real problem is a 79-year-old president who’s stuck in the past.
item.dc:creator: Simone Iglesias, Martha Viotti Beck

media:content.media:description: Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, center, waves to the crowd at Planalto Palace in Brasilia after being sworn in as president in January 2023.

item.title: Johnson Urges Senate to Minimize Changes to $40,000 SALT Deal
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson said he’s pressuring Senate Republicans to refrain from changing a deal to increase the state and local tax deduction cap to $40,000, pushing back on President Donald Trump’s willingness to scale back the write-off.
item.dc:creator: Skylar Woodhouse, Jennifer A Dlouhy

media:content.media:description: US House Speaker Mike Johnson.

item.title: Senator Shot in Head ‘Needs a Miracle’ as Colombia Reels
item.description: Last Thursday, presidential hopeful Miguel Uribe Turbay warned that Colombia was fast sinking back into its violent past. Two days later, a gunman shot him in the head during a rally.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bristow, Patricia Laya

media:content.media:description: A protest against violence the day after the attack on Uribe in Medellin, Colombia, on June 8. Photographer: Jaime Saldarriaga/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: What to Watch for ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ in the Senate This Week
item.description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
item.dc:creator: Nathan R Dean

item.title: Trump to Keep White House Starlink as Musk Feud Dissipates
item.description: President Donald Trump reiterated his desire to end his public spat with Elon Musk, telling reporters he would retain Starlink internet service at the White House and that he wished his billionaire backer “very well.”
item.dc:creator: Skylar Woodhouse, Tyler Kendall

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Trump Says Iran Pushing to Enrich Uranium in ‘Tough’ Talks
item.description: President Donald Trump said Iran was pressing to be allowed to enrich uranium in a potential nuclear deal with the US, expressing worry that Tehran was seeking too much.
item.dc:creator: Hadriana Lowenkron

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump (C), flanked by US Speaker of the House Mike Johnson (L) and White House Chief of Staff Susie Wiles (R), speaks during an "Invest America" roundtable discussion in the State Dining Room of the White House in Washington, DC on June 9, 2025. (Photo by Brendan SMIALOWSKI / AFP)

item.title: Paraguay’s President Deletes Bitcoin Post in Likely Crypto Scam
item.description: Paraguayan President Santiago Peña deleted a post on his X account after a likely hack by crypto scammers who claimed the South American nation had approved Bitcoin as legal tender.
item.dc:creator: Ken Parks

media:content.media:description: Santiago Pena, Paraguay's president, during a news conference at the Mercosur Leaders Summit in Montevideo, Uruguay, on Friday, Dec. 6, 2024. The long-delayed trade deal between the European Union and Latin America’s Mercosur bloc, which has been a quarter of a century in the making, was agreed to in principle in 2019 but has mainly been held up by French objections since.

item.title: US May Exhaust Debt-Ceiling Measures in Mid-August, CBO Says
item.description: The US government could run out of enough funds to meet its financial obligations in a timely manner between mid-August and the end of September, the Congressional Budget Office said Monday.
item.dc:creator: Jarrell Dillard

media:content.media:description: The US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, June 2, 2025. Significant changes are in store for President Donald Trump's signature $3.9 trillion tax-cut bill as the Senate begins closed-door talks this week on legislation that squeaked through the House by a single vote.

item.title: Senate Republicans Plan to Release Major Revisions to Trump’s Tax Bill
item.description: Senate Republicans intend to propose revised tax and health-care provisions to President Donald Trump’s $3 trillion signature economic package this week, shrugging off condemnations of the legislation by Elon Musk as they rush to enact it before July 4.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson

media:content.media:description: The US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. US House Speaker Mike Johnson said he is fighting to maintain the new $40,000 cap on state and local deductions in the draft tax bill now before the Senate, where Republicans are seeking to enact a less generous break.

item.title: NJ Wind Project That Trump Dubbed a Disaster Is Canceled
item.description: The developer of a New Jersey offshore wind farm designed to power more than 700,000 homes has pulled the plug on the project, the latest setback for a sector whose prospects have worsened under the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Josh Saul
